name: Aquatic connectivity or fish passage
functionStatement: Continuous pathways for free movement of water, sediment, and organisms supporting recolonization, maintaining species diversity, and enabling recovery.
descriptionMarkdown: Floodplain/wetlands accessible for semiaquatic fauna unless steep canyons preclude it.
methodContextMarkdown:
Context: Channel and Watershed

Method: Desktop
howToMeasureMarkdown: Inventory barriers and compute percent of network accessible from the reach using network tracing where possible. Note barrier type and location.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: 80-100% of habitat accessible. No major barriers.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: <20% accessible due to major dams or multiple blockages.

references: National Aquatic Barrier Inventory and/or state fish passage databases.
